page.title: 02POPULATION IN DUNURE
page.content: The nature of the population of Dunure has changed considerably over the past 50 years.Where once the village was a cluster of fishermen's cottages around the harbour - mostly one or two apartments occupied by large families, with the building of Council and private houses the village has grown. Fishermen and farm workers' cottages have been sold and modernised,and a different population has evolved who commute daily to business in nearby towns.Wives also have joined the changing times and many travel to work.The village now houses only 38 fishermen and their families and numbers 20 retired fishermen.Retired and redundant farm workers are also housed here.The 1981 census records population of 527 in village and figure of about 900 for whole area is latest obtainable from Registrar.
